experience: You and Steve both know Anders Tyslan, Matthew Cato, and 25 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
You both worked at Charles Schwab in Nov 2016
Certified Scrum Master:  Trade Order Entry System

I led a fast-tracked project to deliver the “All In One Trade Tool”, an advanced trading software tool that allows 3000+ Customer Service Reps to submit simple and complex trade orders for over 10M clients. Delivered new trading functionality that existing legacy systems could not provide. Followed an intuitive workflow that aligned with the way Active Traders think about trading.  •      Delivered project in half the scheduled time to meet management’s aggressive deadline.•      Optimized delivery of User Stories and maximized sprint velocity by ensuring the appropriate level of flexibility with the Agile Methodology by self-organizing Scrum Teams.•      Facilitated  writing of User Stories and Acceptance Criteria.•      Conducted Product Backlog Grooming/Refinement Ceremonies and story point estimations. •      Managed User Stories, Bugs, Issues, Epics, Themes using TFS, JIRA and Confluence tools.•      Led weekly Bug/Defect Triage meetings to prioritize the Defects Backlog and assigned resources to fix defects, ensuring Product Owners a quick and prioritized response to defect resolution.
Certified Scrum Master:  Social Media & Networking Website

I led the full lifecycle project management to implemented 5 upgrades of Jive Software that supports Schwab's social media Trading Community site.  The site is used by industry Leaders, Clients and 1M+ Active Traders to share insights and information about market conditions and trading opportunities.  Grew user base from 1,500 to 1.5M+,  increasing trade activity and revenues from trade commissions.  	•   Conducted initial project kick-off meeting with Business Stakeholders to identify project requirements, communication strategy, project management methodology, resources, constraints and schedule. 	•   Conducted Sprint Zero to create Team Agreement, identify roles and responsibilities, procure hardware, write User Stories, build development and test environments, build Product Backlogs.	•   Conducted Gap Analysis to identify and prioritize new product features. Worked with Product Owners and Scrum Team to write clear and detailed User Stories, and appropriately prioritize.	•   Defined hardware/software/databases/services/vendors with IT Technical Analyst. Cross-collaborated with the Creative UI and Design team to design the user interface. Obtained approvals from Regulatory/Compliance/Legal/Vendor Management departments.  	•   Led weekly project team meetings to review progress of current sprints, overall project status, report major accomplishments, track progress on key issues and risks, and coordination with external interfaces/dependencies.
Senior Project Manager:  MS Sharepoint Administration

Administered SharePoint and provided leadership to 4000+ users and 1000+ SharePoint sites used by 9 organizations for collaboration, document storage, content management and information sharing. 	• Defined strategic direction and brand of SharePoint by participating on a Leadership Task Force.  	• Managed day-to-day operations of SharePoint, including establishing policies and best practice procedures that maintained the integrity of each organization's content management portals.  		• Led 5 organizations with 3000+ people through a comprehensive reengineering, work redesign and process improvement effort of SharePoint sites.  Employed SharePoint best practices to reduce unnecessary content by 60% and reduce redundant SharePoint sites from 1500 to 300, resulting in easier use and increased team collaboration and productivity. 	• Provided governance for document management, promoted best practice workflows within the SharePoint environment, and identified SharePoint features to Business Units that drove collaboration, project productivity, efficiency and quality.
Certified Scrum Master:  Trade Feedback Tool

I led a Scrum Team of 5+ to build an advanced trading software tool used by 1.5M Active Traders to easily evaluate key financial data, identify favorable trends, and quickly make informed decisions that lead to trading opportunities.  The tool featured charts and an intuitive UI workflow that suited an Active Investor's trade style and strategy.	• Created Team Agreements that provided guidelines for the Scrum Team on how to self-organize and work together to create a positive, productive work process.   	• Created Story Point Guides used by Scrum Teams to make relative comparisons to a reference baseline when estimating story points for their User Stories.	• Facilitated Sprint Retrospectives using Confluence tool to identify lessons learned after every sprint.
Certified Scrum Master:  User Login & Password Authentication

Led the Scrum of Scrums for this project that incorporated enhanced risk-based authentication (RBA) technology into the User ID and password process for mobile and Windows applications. Delivered a world-class system, used by 10M clients to log into their financial accounts, and included state-of-the-art user authentication, rigorous fraud detection and prevention services.	• Strengthened the security measures used during the user login and password process to rigorously authenticate user credentials, detect fraud, and deny access to fraudulent login attempts.  	• Prevented schedule delays by ensuring tight coordination and communication of development/testing efforts between 7 external team. Clearly defined system interfaces and ensured timely flow of work between the teams.	• Facilitated meetings/ceremonies with globally diverse teams using WebEx video conferencing.
Professional Certification in Project Management that includes 2 years of formal PM training on PMI’s Project Management Book of Knowledge (PMBOK) processes and techniques.
Professional Certification in Project Management that includes 2 years of formal PM training on PMI’s Project Management Book of Knowledge (PMBOK) processes and techniques.

February 18, 2017, Steve worked with Umayal in the same group

"As the Scrum Master Steve was humble, pleasant and eloquent during our Scrum meetings. He always focused on keeping the team on track. He managed the meetings very well and made sure every team member gets his/her turn to update, he also balanced time keeping the discussion at the right level. He helped the team in resolving blockers or barriers to keep up the timeline and quality.  Steve had great knowledge about the project and the process, he was able to resolve issues effectively. He helped the team members by sending frequent reminders and updates about the sprints and the tasks taken by each member.  Steve guided the team in Scrum Practices which includes Agile Ceremonies,Retrospectives and Standup meetings.He valued each team member's reviews and comments during the retrospectives and has helped the team to improve the process by comparing the comments in each retrospectives.  It was nice working with Steve Smykowski and hoping to work with him again."

Steve has a very positive attitude and doesn't give up. It was great to see the hard work pay off with the successful deployment. I look forward to staying in touch with Steve and hope we can work together again.

Steve is an efficient and professional manager who is capable of learning new concepts very quickly and can adapt to new situations with agility. He collaborates very well with scrum teams, product owners, business partners, vendors and and can independently lead multiple projects from ideation through delivery of results.He is very responsible person and with his excellent communication & presentation skills, he takes care of every minor detail. As a Scrum Master, he has always been available for the team and guided the team in right direction by coordinating with all other dependent teams. He has always been reachable to resolve any kind of issues and takes care until the issue is resolved completely.I enjoyed working with Steve for the last couple of years and I strongly believe he is a great person to work with and I also feel privileged for being a part of his team. As a great human being, Steve has always been very helpful, kind and optimistic. With his excellent project managerial skills and expertise, I am confident in his continued success.

Brenda Schulze (MBA, PMP, CSM)
Senior Business and Information Technology Leader
November 16, 2016, Steve worked with Brenda in different groups

As the Project Manager for a highly visible, high priority security project, I want to thank Brenda for her excellent participation and support on this project which had aggressive timelines and involved work from many different teams.  Brenda was the Project Manager for a team that delivered a critical interface to our team.  Her team's interface was a dependency that contributed to the project’s overall success.  Brenda served as a key liaison between our two teams, as well as several other key teams responsible for building specific functionality that interfaced with our project.  I met with her regularly to coordinate our team’s activities; she also participated in our weekly team meetings that coordinated the work from each of these various teams.  Brenda always came to the meetings well-prepared, and was responsive to our team’s questions and needs, particularly on the Business Requirements.  Her contributions during these meetings allowed our team to successfully deliver on our commitments to our Business Partners in a timely manner.  She presented herself in a very professional, pleasant and supportive manner.  All in all, I was quite pleased that Brenda filled this critical role on the project and I would certainly welcome her to another project team that I manage.  Thank you, Brenda, for your contributions and for helping us make this project a success!

As the Scrum Master, I want to acknowledge Uma’s good work while she was a member of our Agile Scrum Team.  Uma served in a QA role on a highly visible, high priority project that had a very aggressive timeline.  She effectively participated in all of the Agile Ceremonies, including demo-ing her completed work at the end of each sprint.  When she joined the team, she quickly came up to speed with her role and was quick to be productive.  Uma has a very kind, gentle and respectful demeanor, which allowed her to create very amicable working relationships with her fellow Scrum Team members as well as our Business Partners.  I knew that when Uma was relatively quiet during our Daily Scrums, things were running smoothly with her work.  And when Uma would encounter road-blocks with the work, or needed additional information or direction, she would very diplomatically lead a conversation until she had a resolution or got the information that she needed to successfully deliver her commitments.   She is a conscientious worker who takes pride in delivering correct and complete work as well as honoring her commitments.  I’ve enjoyed having Uma as part of our Scrum Team, and I would certainly welcome her with open arms to another Scrum Team that I manage.

summary: You name it, and I will deliver it with confidence and enthusiasm.  I am a highly-motivated, experienced Agile Scrum Master (CSM) and Project Management Professional (PMP) with a proven ability to lead teams through the maze of tasks and deliver world-class products.I am a "Master Organizer" with an eye for detail, meticulously executing projects and energizing teams to success.  My passion is to make teams successful and feel valued.  I believe the most important thing is to create a climate of trust, confidence and mutual respect.  I am known for giving credit and recognition to those who have contributed.   I am the Project Manager that Business Partners request.  Specialties:  Agile Scrum Coaching; Project Management; Servant Leadership; Facilitating Daily Scrums, Sprint Planning, Sprint Reviews, Retrospectives; Collaboration and Product Owner Partnerships; Requirements Prioritization; Project Organization; Metrics; Continuous Improvements and Best Practices; Building High Performing, Self-Organizing Teams; Leading Cross-Functional Distributed Teams; Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
name: Steve Smykowski, CSM, PMP
title: Scrum Master | Technical Project Manager | MS SharePoint
